intro: Casimira, commonly known as the "Cape jasmine," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their fragrant, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters.
